biogHist.abstract: Broome Residential College opened in 2008, to provide accommodation for young people going to high school in Broome. It was one of the Country High School Hostels Authority colleges.
biogHist.p: Broome Residential College was established by the Country High School Hostels Authority in 2008. The Redress WA schedule of 'Facilities Operated Subject to the Country High School [Hostels] Authority Act 1960 - Past and Present' (18 May 2011) includes a reference to the Broome Residential College. It has been common practice in Western Australia for children who were in the care of the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the department responsible for child welfare to be boarded in one of the Authority's hostels.

chronItem.event: Location - Broome Residential College accommodated high school students in Broome

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Country High School Hostels Authority, State of Western Australia (1960 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The Country High School Hostels Authority was required by s7(1)(b) of its Act to 'supervise and maintain' this residential college.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Country High School Hostels Authority Act 1960 (Western Australia)

archref.unittitle: Country High School Hostels Authority Act 1960 (Western Australia)
archref.abstract: The Country High School Hostels Authority Act 1960 established and governed the operations of the Country High School Hostels Authority. It was not uncommon for children who were Wards of the State to be boarded in one of the Authority's hostels.
